title: Difference between Chief Joseph and Parker

content.prompt: Which of the following describes a difference between the arguments made by Chief Joseph and Commissioner Parker in the excerpts?

choices.label: Chief Joseph supported the reservation system for Native Americans, while Commissioner Parker condemned reservations.
Chief Joseph believed that Native American tribes had a right to sovereignty, while Commissioner Parker believed that Native American tribes were not sovereign nations.
Chief Joseph sought additional support for agriculture on reservations, while Commissioner Parker called for industrialization on reservations.
Chief Joseph asserted that Native Americans should never interact with government officials, while Commissioner Parker argued that they should be represented in Washington.

topic.text: 6.3: Westward Expansion - Social and Cultural Development

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Compare the arguments or main ideas of two sources.
